reviews.review_text: I have all of this authors books just needed this one to complete my collection.

I love Zafon's ability to take the reader from "today" or "reality", if you want to call it that, to the dream-like situation that gripped this reader. Zafon has the ability to lead the unsuspecting reader into an adventure of the mind the end of which is difficult to predict.  In my opinion, Zafon is an outstanding writer of unusual plots with unpredictable endings.  I thoroughly enjoy this author's work.
I liked this book, perhaps not as much as I liked, "The Shadow Of The Wind," but worth the read.
Was anxious for a new Zafon book, and Marina didn't disappoint!

This is a beautiful love story with adventure, excitement,  beautiful memories, and death. Two lonely souls find each other and become the closest of friends. They encounter intrigue, and frightful experiences running through the underground tunnels & labyrinth beneath city streets. They encounter the less fortunate who live there, a lot of them left over from the war. A great read which was hard to put down!
a master story  teller early work that show aclear eviance  of his talent that will truly shine in his master piece shadows of the wind.
Still trying to get through this book. Initially caught my interest, but couldn't keep it. Lots of characters but confusing story line. Don't waste your money.
Love this writer. Book is easy to read, plot is gripping and adventurous.

summary:
"We all have a secret buried under lock and key in the attic of our soul. This is mine."

When Fifteen-year-old Oscar Drai suddenly vanishes from his boarding school in Barcelona, no one knows his whereabouts for seven days and seven nights.

His story begins when he meets the strange Marina while he's exploring an old quarter of the city. She leads Oscar to a cemetery, where they watch a macabre ritual that occurs on the last Sunday of each month. At exactly ten o'clock in the morning, a woman shrouded in a black velvet cloak descends from her carriage to place a single rose on an unmarked grave.

When Oscar and Marina decide to follow her, they begin a journey that transports them to a forgotten postwar Barcelona--a world of aristocrats and actresses, inventors and tycoons--an reveals a dark secret that lies waiting in the mysterious labyrinth beneath the city streets.

Carlos Ruiz Zafon's haunting Marina has long been a cult classic in Spain and is now an international bestseller.
